name: Grosvenor House, A JW Marriott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Priceline provided a great price for a three night stay. Very convenient for Oxford Street shopping, about 300yds to the Marble Arch end. An underground NCP car park immediately opposite that gives 1/2 price parking for 72hrs if you get your show ticket validated. Room was more spacious than is usual in London, huge bed, lovely bath. Lack of tea/coffee facilities the only drawback.
reviews.title: Good location, good price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed, using our Marriott points, at the Marriott Grosvenor House at the end of our two week vacation in Britain. The hotel is in a great location - walking distance to many of the London attractions and convenient to the underground. Check-in was easy. Internet is availabe but very expensive. We opted to purchase an internet card from the Business Center (90 minutes for 10 GBP) so we could check our e-mail, news and Texas Ranger baseball scores!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nicely appointed although it did not have a coffee pot or electric kettle. The hotel was kind enough to bring us one to use during our stay. We did not eat at the hotel opting to eat at some of our favorite London restaurants.
reviews.title: One big step below the best London hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in many of the London Marriotts over the years. This one met our expectations.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Grosvenor House for 5 nights. The rooms and the common areas are nice and reasonably well equipped, but some mistakes and delays in providing different services show that the hotel is not in the same level than, for quoting as example some of its more exclusive neighbours, The Dorchester or The Lanesborough.
reviews.title: Grosvenor House is still the best, but now you can earn Marriott points!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 6 nights while visiting our daughter in London. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice--could have used cable TV. The different dining options were also very good. The location was excellent as we walked Hyde park every morning. We used marriott points to book this hotel and all went smoothly. We are looking forward to visiting London and this hotel soon.
reviews.title: Delightful week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a bit nervous with choosing the Grosvenor House for our first London vacation. Everything was PERFECT. The location is spectacular - it's nice and quiet, but a quick walk north brings you to marble arch - or a 10 minute walk south brings you to Buckingham palace. The room we got was huge(I am not sure if I got upgraded being Marriott Gold).
reviews.title: Perfect stay at Grosvenor House

reviews.text: Excellent staff and the facilities are spotless.
reviews.title: Great deal! Some tips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great pub around the corner called the Audley.
reviews.title: Now our hotel of choice in London.

reviews.text: If I go back to London - I would stay here again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Disregard ALL of the negative reviews...if you are not satisfied, it's because NOTHING will satisfy you!
Very High standard for the UK
reviews.text: Hotels in the UK are not generally a great standard, but the Grosvenor was surprisingly nice and to a very high standard. I would recommend it highly. It was very modern and very high class it you want a good standard for London stay here not cheap though.

reviews.title: disappointment of losing personal items at 5-star hotel
reviews.text: I have stayed in all types of hotels before and I have never before lost anything in any of these places. Although the staff was friendly at JW Grosvenor House (except security manager), they were not able to solve the mystery of disappearance of my personal items from the room. It partly ruined my vacation and I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone as I wouldn't want anybody to be worried about their things left in the room while they were out and about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 3 night break in London. Stayed at the JW Grosvenor House Park Lane. Travelled with my husband. The whole experience was wonderful. The location is perfect easy walking distance to sights - Hotel looks onto Hyde Park. Tubes are only minutes away eg Marble Arch to the right while Hyde Park corner to the left. Buses stop on Park Lane, so your choice is endless. Hotel staff were excellent. Never had such a wonderful breakfast from a hotel. This hotel is a little bit expensive but considering the area it is worth it and don't forget Marriott rewards - we got three nights for two. Restaurants in the area are fab. Had a wonderful meal in KAI - by far the best chinnese meal I ever had. Worth travelling to London just for that. Aslo ate in Piccolino - italian restaurant just off Regents street (twice) wonderful food and staff so frendly. Excellent service
reviews.title: Stylish, Elegance, Perfection.

reviews.text: The location was fantastic, the staff was friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: execellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room looked as if all the furnishings were brand new!
reviews.title: Luxury in London has a new home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the Christmas and New Year holiday in London.
reviews.title: Great old hotel w/poor concierge service

reviews.text: Although we arrived early in the AM, the front desk staff was able to check us in.
reviews.title: luxury has a new name

reviews.text: After viewing several rooms, we settled on a smoking room on the 4th floor.
reviews.title: Loved the location

likes.disliked: — The staff had an annoying habit of knocking on the door and entering in the room in the morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thankfully the room had no residual smoke odor. The full english breakfast was wonderful. We found the restaurant staff very attentive. Our only complaint about the hotel was the poorly trained concierge staff and doormen. When we asked the concierge to book an afternoon tea appointment for us, he only dialed the number and handed me the phone. As someone who is used to quality and personal JW Marriott service in the states, I was quite frankly shocked. My second complaint occurred when we were leaving. The day before we left, my husband checked with the concierge desk about getting a taxi early in the morning to the airport. He was assured that it would not be a problem on New Year's Day. The next morning when we were leaving, we could not find a doorman and this was at 9 AM!!!! Nor could we find someone at the concierge desk. We had to get someone from the front desk to go behind the concierge desk to look for the doorman. Apparently he was too busy socializing with the concierge that morning. As I waited for my husband at the door, several other hotel guests came out of the hotel looking for a cab. After standing around for awhile, those guests decided to walk to the main street to look for a cab. Other than those incidents, I would say the hotel was acceptable.
reviews.title: Very Nice - nothing but good things to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: its one of a kind place to be in when your in london its excellent beautiful and classy
reviews.title: Great hotel if you use Priceline.
